private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H (A is smallest, H is the 8th smallest).
I may not move disks I through O.
agent_1.goal: Collaborate to achieve the target Tower of Hanoi configuration and produce my portion of the ordered primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

private_information: I can move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O (O is the largest).
I may not move disks A through H.
agent_2.goal: Collaborate to achieve the target Tower of Hanoi configuration and produce my portion of the ordered primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

private_information: I coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and integrate their partial plans into a single valid plan.
I must produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver and provide the complete ordered list of primitive moves respecting agent restrictions and Hanoi rules.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' plans and produce a valid PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward, plus the final ordered list of primitive moves formatted as 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

public_information: This is a standard Tower of Hanoi with 3 pegs named left, middle, right and 15 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O where A is smallest and O is largest.
Initial configuration on left peg from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Middle and right pegs are initially empty.
Goal configuration: left peg from top to bottom must be D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg empty; right peg from top to bottom must be A, B, C.

Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk moved at a time; a disk can only be placed on an empty peg or on a larger disk; agents are limited to moving specific disks as specified by their private information.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 controlling disks A through H. Using only valid Tower of Hanoi moves and respecting that you cannot move disks I through O, produce the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not produce PDDL. Keep moves only for disks A through H and ensure each individual move obeys the Hanoi stacking rule.

You are agent_2 controlling disks I through O. Using only valid Tower of Hanoi moves and respecting that you cannot move disks A through H, produce the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not produce PDDL. Keep moves only for disks I through O and ensure each individual move obeys the Hanoi stacking rule.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the ordered partial moves from agent_1 and agent_2, resolve any ordering conflicts, and produce: (1) a complete PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver that models the two-agent Tower of Hanoi with distinct agent actions, and (2) the final combined ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct (for example, separate action names or agent predicates) so the solver can reason about which agent performs which move. The PDDL and the final move list must reflect the agent move restrictions and standard Hanoi rules.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the partial move lists from both agents. Integrate them into a valid global plan and produce PDDL for FastDownward as well as the final ordered move list that achieves the specified goal configuration while respecting the agent-specific disk movement restrictions.
